Tudor Cebere

I am an third-year PhD student at Inria ðŸ‡«ðŸ‡·, supervised by AurÃ©lien Bellet. During my PhD, I visited the Vector Institute ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡¦ hosted by Nicolas Papernot and Harvard ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ hosted by the OpenDP group.

I am interested in differential privacy (DP) and its applications in creating trustworthy machine learning models. In particular, I am interested in the guarantees offered by differential privacy in various threat models and the associated practical guarantees, beyond the worst-case ones.

I graduated from Ã‰cole normale supÃ©rieure de Lyon (ENS Lyon) with a masters in Theoretical CS, where I was fortunate to receive an AmpÃ¨re Scholarship of Excellence. Before that, I received my BSc in EECS from Politehnica University of Bucharest ðŸ‡·ðŸ‡´.
